text:
Looks like the new version broke today.
(June 9)
As soon as I got the new version, the initial display of 
a receiver took minutes.
I am using a simple socket receiver.
The second time my app runs, it shows a connection being
made, but no logging info ever appears.

not very useful like this!

-steve
creator: skearns23@yahoo.com

text:
Works for me.  I've just used the latest Web start build, tried the Tutorial and 
also connected to a local app using the SocketHubReceiver by creating it inside 
the GUI.

Can you provide us with any more information?  Is there anything in the Web 
start logs area that you might be able to pastet into this bug?

cheers,

Paul Smith
creator: paul.smith@lawlex.com.au

text:
Had you previously downloaded Chainsaw via CVS and haven't used it in a while?

We changed the units used in the throttling mechanism, and if you haven't used
it since we changed (a couple of months ago, and prior to web start version),
that would cause this problem.

Try deleting all files in the .chainsaw directory (in your userprofile directory
or home dir), and let us know if that fixes it.  We save panel and app-wide
preferences in there.  If you don't want to lose your log panel settings, just
delete the chainsaw.settings.properties file.  (on my box it's
C:\WINDOWS\Profiles\scott\.chainsaw)

Scott
creator: sdeboy@iname.com

text:
More info:  

Thanks for the suggestions, but I tried deleting the .chainsaw directory,
plus removed from webstart and reinstalled, but the behavior remains
similarly unuseable.

I have been using chainsaw for weeks with the same program;  the problems
only began after the new version downloaded.  The program IS compute
intensive, and my machine is not the fastest available although it is
decent (an IBM Thinkpad T21)

Further, the built in Swing logging viewer and the file appender work
just as before.

so it really seems as if there is something about this new version that
makes it starved for compute or network cycles.
creator: skearns23@yahoo.com

text:
The 'responsiveness' slider logic did change for the 'fastest' setting and now performs a yield in between event processing.  

If you are familiar with CVS, I'd suggest retrieving the logging-log4j module from apache's CVS repository and retrieving based on date (maybe 1 week or 2 weeks ago) and see if you have the same problem.

If it's resolved in the old version, at least we can verify it's a code change that caused the problem.

Feel free to provide patches if you find the problem.

Thanks,
Scott
creator: sdeboy@iname.com
yoavs@computer.org
text:
I'm taking the lack of comments since Scott's last message as lack of interest, 
thereby closing this item.  To the OP: if the problem persists, please reopen 
this issue.  Thanks.
